Hey, may as well jump in here and ask about my tanto also.  Please 
refer to the Photos section at left, in the NC folder.  The tanto is 
signed Bishu Osafune Kiyo(mitsu?) and Eiroku jyu ichi (nen?) (?) 
gatsu hi (1568).  Q #1:  Is it indeed kazu uchimono?  Seems so, given 
the Bishu vs. Bizen mei, the date, plus it also has a lot of loose 
hada and forging ware.  Q #2:  Any idea as to which Kiyomitsu made 
it?  Q #3:  Is it common for kazu uchimono of this area and time to 
have loads of utsuri and nijuba/sanjuba as does this example?  That 
is, while the forging was apparently quick and dirty, it appears that 
this blade got the full professional tempering treatment.  Possibly 
the smiths were so used to doing the tempering correctly that they 
just did it as a matter of course, even for bundled blades?  Thanks 
in advance for any and all input!

NC
